# Apple TV Remote Marketing Website - Initial Repository Setup ## Overview This repository contains the complete marketing website for **Apple TV Remote**, a native macOS desktop application that enables users to control their Apple TV directly from their Mac. The website is built with modern web technologies, featuring world-class internationalization (24 languages), accessibility compliance, and SEO optimization. **Live URL**: https://appletvremote.app --- ## Product: Apple TV Remote ### What It Does Apple TV Remote is a macOS desktop application that transforms your Mac into a full-featured Apple TV remote control. Key capabilities: - **Device Discovery**: Automatically discovers all Apple TVs on your local network using Bonjour/mDNS protocol - **Full Remote Control**: 21 commands including navigation (up, down, left, right), select, menu, home, play/pause, volume controls, skip forward/back, Siri activation, sleep, and screen saver - **Keyboard Shortcuts**: Native keyboard support - arrow keys navigate, Enter selects, Space plays/pauses, Escape goes back, customizable shortcuts - **Now Playing Widget**: Real-time display of current media with album art, title, artist, and playback progress - **Text Input**: Type on Apple TV search keyboards using your Mac keyboard instead of navigating letter by letter - **System Tray Integration**: Quick access from your Mac menu bar with status indicators and quick actions - **Always on Top**: Keep the remote visible while using other apps - **Dark Mode**: Automatic theme switching based on macOS appearance settings - **Auto-Reconnect**: Automatic connection recovery when Mac wakes or network changes ### Target Audience - Mac users who own Apple TVs - Power users who prefer keyboard over physical remotes - Developers working with Apple TV apps - Home theater enthusiasts --- ## Technology Stack ### Core Framework - **Next.js 16** with App Router (React 19) - **TypeScript** for type safety - **pnpm** package manager ### Styling - **Tailwind CSS v4** with CSS variables - **Neobrutalist design system** - bold, high-contrast UI with distinctive visual style - **Custom RetroUI component library** built on Radix primitives ### Internationalization - **next-intl** for i18n (24 locales) - **RTL support** for Arabic, Persian, Hebrew - **JSONC source format** with build-time JSON conversion ### Animation - **Framer Motion** with lazy loading for performance - **Feature page animations** demonstrating each capability ### SEO - **JSON-LD structured data** (SoftwareApplication, FAQ, HowTo, Organization, BreadcrumbList) - **Dynamic sitemap** with all 24 locales - **Metadata generation** per page/locale ### Deployment - **Vercel** (primary) - SSR/SSG hybrid - **Cloudflare Pages** (alternative) - static export --- ## OG image â””â”€â”€ twitter-image.png # Twitter card image ``` ### Route Groups Explained Next.js 16 route groups organize pages without affecting URL structure: | Route Group | Pages | Purpose | |-------------|-------|---------| | `(marketing)` | `/`, `/about`, `/download`, `/pricing`, `/features/*` | Core marketing content | | `(legal)` | `/privacy`, `/terms`, `/refund-policy` | Legal documents | | `(support)` | `/faq`, `/contact` | User support | Each group can have its own layout, loading states, and error boundaries. ### Dynamic Routes **Feature pages** use `[feature]` dynamic segment: - URL: `/en/features/device-discovery` - File: `app/[locale]/(marketing)/features/[feature]/page.tsx` - Content: `lib/content/features/device-discovery.ts` **Locale routing** uses `[locale]` segment at root: - All 24 locales supported - Automatic locale detection - SEO-friendly URLs with `localePrefix: 'always'` --- ## Internationalization System ### Supported Locales (24) | Code | Language | Direction | |------|----------|-----------| | en | English | LTR | | ar | Arabic | **RTL** | | bg | Bulgarian | LTR | | cs | Czech | LTR | | de | German | LTR | | es | Spanish | LTR | | fa | Persian | **RTL** | | fil | Filipino | LTR | | fr | French | LTR | | he | Hebrew | **RTL** | | hi | Hindi | LTR | | hu | Hungarian | LTR | | id | Indonesian | LTR | | it | Italian | LTR | | ja | Japanese | LTR | | nl | Dutch | LTR | | pl | Polish | LTR | | pt | Portuguese | LTR | | ru | Russian | LTR | | th | Thai | LTR | | tr | Turkish | LTR | | vi | Vietnamese | LTR | | zh | Chinese | LTR | ### RTL Support RTL locales (Arabic, Persian, Hebrew) automatically receive: - `dir="rtl"` attribute on `` - Tailwind RTL utilities work correctly - Component layouts flip appropriately Configuration in `i18n/config.ts`: ```typescript export const rtlLocales = ['ar', 'fa', 'he'] as const; export const isRTL = (locale: Locale) => rtlLocales.includes(locale as typeof rtlLocales[number]); ``` ### Translation Workflow 1. **Source files** in `messages-src/{locale}/index.jsonc` (JSONC format with comments) 2. **Build step** converts JSONC â†’ JSON via `scripts/jsonc-to-json.ts` 3. **Output** to `messages/{locale}/index.json` (gitignored) Commands: ```bash pnpm i18n:build # Convert JSONC â†’ JSON pnpm i18n:audit # Find missing translation keys pnpm i18n:lint # Lint translation files pnpm i18n:compare # Compare across locales ``` ### Translation Keys Structure ```jsonc { // Navigation "nav": { "features": "Features", "pricing": "Pricing", "download": "Download", "faq": "FAQ" }, // Hero section "hero": { "title": "CONTROL YOUR", "titleHighlight": "APPLE TV", "badge": "NEW: Now Playing widget is here" }, // Feature pages "features": { "cards": { "deviceDiscovery": { "title": "Device Discovery", "description": "Automatically finds all Apple TVs..." } } }, // FAQ "faq": { "items": { "whatIsThis": { "q": "What is Apple TV Remote?", "a": "A native macOS app that lets you..." } } } } ``` --- ## Component System ### RetroUI Design System All components in `components/retroui/` follow neobrutalist design principles: - **Bold borders**: 2-3px black borders - **Hard shadows**: Offset box shadows (e.g., `shadow-[4px_4px_0_0_black]`) - **High contrast**: Strong color differentiation - **Brutalist typography**: Bold headlines, clear hierarchy Components are built on **Radix UI primitives** for accessibility: - Proper ARIA attributes - Keyboard navigation - Focus management - Screen reader support Example Button variants: ```tsx ``` ### Icon Registry Type-safe icon system using Lucide React: ```tsx import { Icon, type IconId } from "@/lib/icons/registry"; // Usage ``` Available icons: `keyboard`, `tv`, `monitor`, `volume-2`, `play`, `pause`, `skip-forward`, `skip-back`, `home`, `menu`, `search`, `settings`, `chevron-up`, `chevron-down`, `chevron-left`, `chevron-right`, and 40+ more. ### Lazy-Loaded Animations Framer Motion is lazy-loaded to reduce initial bundle: ```tsx import { MotionDiv, AnimatePresence } from "@/lib/motion"; // Instead of direct framer-motion import // import { motion } from "framer-motion"; ``` This pattern reduces JavaScript payload for users who don't interact with animated elements. --- ## Feature Pages ### 11 Feature Pages Each feature has a dedicated page with: - Hero section with feature title/description - Animated demonstration - Benefits list - How-it-works steps - Call-to-action | Feature ID | URL | Animation Component | |------------|-----|---------------------| | device-discovery | /features/device-discovery | DeviceDiscoveryAnimation | | remote-control | /features/remote-control | RemoteControlAnimation | | keyboard-shortcuts | /features/keyboard-shortcuts | KeyboardShortcutsAnimation | | now-playing | /features/now-playing | NowPlayingAnimation | | volume-control | /features/volume-control | VolumeControlAnimation | | text-input | /features/text-input | TextInputAnimation | | auto-reconnect | /features/auto-reconnect | AutoReconnectAnimation | | system-tray | /features/system-tray | SystemTrayAnimation | | always-on-top | /features/always-on-top | AlwaysOnTopAnimation | | dark-mode | /features/dark-mode | DarkModeAnimation | | neobrutalist-design | /features/neobrutalist-design | NeobrutalistDesignAnimation | ### Content System Feature content is defined in `lib/content/features/{id}.ts`: ```typescript export const deviceDiscoveryContent: FeaturePageData = { id: 'device-discovery', hero: { icon: 'search', gradientColors: ['from-blue-500', 'to-cyan-500'], }, benefits: [ { icon: 'zap', titleKey: 'benefits.automatic.title' }, { icon: 'wifi', titleKey: 'benefits.network.title' }, ], howItWorks: { steps: [ { number: 1, titleKey: 'howItWorks.step1.title' }, { number: 2, titleKey: 'howItWorks.step2.title' }, ], }, }; ``` Text content comes from translations, structure from content files. --- ## SEO Implementation ### Structured Data (JSON-LD) Multiple schema types per page: **SoftwareApplication** (all pages): ```json { "@type": "SoftwareApplication", "name": "Apple TV Remote", "operatingSystem": "macOS", "applicationCategory": "Utilities", "offers": { "@type": "Offer", "price": "17", "priceCurrency": "USD" } } ``` **FAQPage** (FAQ page): ```json { "@type": "FAQPage", "mainEntity": [ { "@type": "Question", "name": "What is Apple TV Remote?", "acceptedAnswer": { "@type": "Answer", "text": "A native macOS app..." } } ] } ``` **HowTo** (feature pages): ```json { "@type": "HowTo", "name": "How to use Device Discovery", "step": [ { "@type": "HowToStep", "name": "Open the app", "text": "Launch Apple TV Remote..." } ] } ``` ### Metadata Generation Each page has `generateMetadata()`: ```typescript export async function generateMetadata({ params }: Props): Promise { const { locale } = await params; const t = await getTranslations({ locale, namespace: 'metadata' }); return { title: t('page.title'), description: t('page.description'), openGraph: { title: t('page.ogTitle'), description: t('page.ogDescription'), images: ['/opengraph-image.png'], }, alternates: { canonical: `https://appletvremote.app/${locale}/page`, languages: Object.fromEntries( locales.map(l => [l, `https://appletvremote.app/${l}/page`]) ), }, }; } ``` ### Sitemap & Robots **Dynamic sitemap** (`app/sitemap.ts`) generates URLs for: - All pages Ã— all locales = comprehensive coverage - Proper `lastmod` timestamps - Priority and changefreq attributes **Dynamic robots.txt** (`app/robots.ts`): ``` User-agent: * Allow: / Sitemap: https://appletvremote.app/sitemap.xml ``` --- ## Build System ### Development ```bash pnpm dev # 1. Runs i18n:build (JSONC â†’ JSON) # 2. Starts Next.js dev server # 3. Hot reloading for all files ``` ### Production Build ```bash pnpm build # 1. pnpm i18n:build (translations) # 2. pnpm generate:og (OG images) # 3. next build (SSG/SSR) ``` ### Static Export (Cloudflare) ```bash pnpm build:cf # 1. STATIC_EXPORT=true pnpm i18n:build # 2. STATIC_EXPORT=true next build # 3. scripts/copy-default-locale.ts (root index) # Output: /out directory for deployment ``` ### Scripts Reference | Script | Purpose | |--------|---------| | `jsonc-to-json.ts` | Converts JSONC with comments to JSON | | `i18n-audit.ts` | Finds hardcoded strings and missing keys | | `lint-translations.ts` | Validates translation file structure | | `translation-compare.ts` | Compares keys across all locales | | `generate-all-og-images.ts` | Generates OpenGraph images | | `copy-default-locale.ts` | Copies /en to / for static export | | `lighthouse-all-pages.ts` | Runs Lighthouse on all pages | | `performance-test.ts` | Automated performance testing | --- ## Accessibility ### WCAG 2.2 Level AA Compliance - **Semantic HTML**: Proper heading hierarchy, landmark regions - **Keyboard navigation**: All interactive elements focusable - **Skip to content**: Skip link for keyboard users - **Focus indicators**: Visible focus states - **Color contrast**: Meets 4.5:1 ratio - **Screen reader support**: ARIA labels, roles, live regions ### Form Accessibility ```tsx {error && {error}} ``` ### Reduced Motion Support ```typescript const prefersReducedMotion = window.matchMedia('(prefers-reduced-motion: reduce)').matches; if (prefersReducedMotion) { // Show static content instead of animations } ``` --- ## Performance Optimizations ### Bundle Optimization - **Package optimization**: Specific imports for large packages - **Code splitting**: Dynamic imports for heavy components - **Tree shaking**: Unused code eliminated - **Lazy loading**: Framer Motion loaded on demand ```typescript // next.config.ts experimental: { optimizePackageImports: [ 'lucide-react', 'framer-motion', '@radix-ui/react-accordion', // ... 15+ more packages ], } ``` ### Image Optimization - **next/image**: Automatic optimization on Vercel - **unoptimized**: Enabled for static export - **WebP/AVIF**: Modern formats where supported ### Font Optimization ```typescript const archivoBlack = Archivo_Black({ subsets: ['latin'], weight: '400', variable: '--font-head', display: 'swap', // Prevent FOIT }); ``` --- ## Deployment ### Vercel (Recommended) Standard Next.js deployment: 1. Connect GitHub repository 2. Configure build command: `pnpm build` 3. Configure output directory: `.next` 4. Set environment variables (if any) Features: - Automatic SSR/SSG detection - Edge Functions support - Image optimization - Analytics ### Cloudflare Pages Static export deployment: 1. Configure build command: `pnpm build:cf` 2. Configure output directory: `out` 3. Deploy static files Configuration in `wrangler.toml`: ```toml name = "apple-tv-remote" pages_build_output_dir = "out" ``` Edge functions in `functions/` directory for dynamic features. --- ## Development Guidelines ### Adding a New Page 1. Create route file: `app/[locale]/(group)/page-name/page.tsx` 2. Add translations to `messages-src/*/index.jsonc` 3. Run `pnpm i18n:build` 4. Add to sitemap if needed ### Adding a New Translation Key 1. Edit `messages-src/en/index.jsonc` (English first) 2. Run `pnpm i18n:audit` to see missing keys in other locales 3. Add to all locales or use fallback 4. Run `pnpm i18n:build` ### Adding a New Icon 1. Add to `lib/icons/registry.tsx`: ```typescript import { NewIcon } from 'lucide-react'; export const iconRegistry = { // ... existing icons 'new-icon': NewIcon, }; ``` 2. Use with type safety: ```tsx ``` ### Adding a New UI Component 1. Create in `components/retroui/ComponentName.tsx` 2. Use Radix primitives for accessibility 3. Follow neobrutalist design patterns 4. Use `bg-background` not `bg-white` for theme support 5. Export from component file --- ## File Counts Summary | Category | Count | |----------|-------| | React Components | ~60 | | Page Routes | ~25 per locale | | Locales | 24 | | Translation Keys | ~1,600 per locale | | Feature Pages | 11 | | UI Components | 13 | | Animation Components | 11 | | Scripts | 8 | --- ## What This PR Contains ### Files Added - Complete Next.js 16 application structure - 24 locale translation files - 11 feature page content definitions - 13 RetroUI components - 11 feature animation components - SEO schema generators - Build and audit scripts ### Key Features Implemented - World-class i18n with 24 languages - RTL support for Arabic, Persian, Hebrew - Accessibility (WCAG 2.2 Level AA) - SEO with JSON-LD structured data - Neobrutalist design system - Performance optimized ### Configuration - `.gitignore` - Aggressive, keeps only essential files - `CLAUDE.md` - AI navigation guide - `README.md` - Developer documentation - `next.config.ts` - Next.js 16 configuration - `wrangler.toml` - Cloudflare Pages config - `vercel.json` - Vercel configuration --- ## Getting Started ```bash # Clone and install git clone https://github.com/[org]/website-appletvremote.git cd website-appletvremote pnpm install # Development pnpm dev # Production build pnpm build # Run linting pnpm lint # Audit translations pnpm i18n:audit ``` --- This is the initial repository setup for the Apple TV Remote marketing website, establishing the foundation for a world-class, multilingual web presence. --- ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **Documentation** * Added comprehensive architecture documentation detailing project structure, technology stack, routing, internationalization support with 24 locales, SEO systems, and deployment configurations. * **Chores** * Updated repository file tracking configuration for documentation files.

Greptile Overview

Greptile Summary

This PR adds comprehensive architecture documentation to help developers understand and contribute to the Apple TV Remote marketing website codebase. **Changes:** - Modified `.gitignore` to whitelist `docs/*.md` files (previously all `.md` files except `CLAUDE.md` and `README.md` were ignored) - Added `docs/ARCHITECTURE.md` with 791 lines of detailed technical documentation **Documentation Coverage:** - **Technology Stack**: Next.js 16, React 19, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS v4, next-intl (24 locales), Framer Motion - **Architecture**: Directory structure, route groups, dynamic routing for features and locales - **Internationalization**: 24 locale support with RTL for Arabic/Persian/Hebrew, JSONC to JSON build pipeline - **Component System**: RetroUI neobrutalist design system built on Radix UI, icon registry, lazy-loaded animations - **SEO**: JSON-LD structured data (SoftwareApplication, FAQPage, HowTo), dynamic sitemap, metadata generation - **Build System**: Development/production/static export workflows, script references - **Accessibility**: WCAG 2.2 Level AA compliance guidelines - **Performance**: Bundle optimization, lazy loading, font optimization strategies - **Deployment**: Vercel (SSR/SSG) and Cloudflare Pages (static) configurations - **Development Guidelines**: How to add pages, translations, icons, and UI components This documentation serves as a comprehensive reference for developers joining the project or implementing new features.

Confidence Score: 5/5

There are no functional changes that could break the application, introduce security vulnerabilities, or cause runtime errors. - No files require special attention - this is purely a documentation PR

+This repository contains the complete marketing website for **Apple TV Remote**, a native macOS desktop application that enables users to control their Apple TV directly from their Mac. +Next.js 16 route groups organize pages without affecting URL structure:

+| `(support)` | `/faq`, `/contact` | User support |

+Each group can have its own layout, loading states, and error boundaries.

+- URL: `/en/features/device-discovery`

+- Automatic locale detection
+- SEO-friendly URLs with `localePrefix: 'always'`

+## Internationalization System
+
+### Supported Locales (24)
+
+| Code | Language | Direction |
+|------|----------|-----------|
+| en | English | LTR |

+| vi | Vietnamese | LTR |
+| zh | Chinese | LTR |
+

+
+RTL locales (Arabic, Persian, Hebrew) automatically receive:
+- `dir="rtl"` attribute on `<html>`
+- Tailwind RTL utilities work correctly
+- Component layouts flip appropriately
+
+Configuration in `i18n/config.ts`:
+```typescript
+export const rtlLocales = ['ar', 'fa', 'he'] as const;
+export const isRTL = (locale: Locale) =>
+  rtlLocales.includes(locale as typeof rtlLocales[number]);
+```
+
+### Translation Workflow
+
+1. **Source files** in `messages-src/{locale}/index.jsonc` (JSONC format with comments)
+2. **Build step** converts JSONC â†’ JSON via `scripts/jsonc-to-json.ts`
+3. **Output** to `messages/{locale}/index.json` (gitignored)
+
+Commands:
+```bash
+pnpm i18n:build   # Convert JSONC â†’ JSON
+pnpm i18n:audit   # Find missing translation keys
+pnpm i18n:lint    # Lint translation files
+pnpm i18n:compare # Compare across locales
+```
+
+### Translation Keys Structure
+
+```jsonc
+{
+  // Navigation
+  "nav": {
+    "features": "Features",
+    "pricing": "Pricing",
+    "download": "Download",
+    "faq": "FAQ"
+  },
+
+  // Hero section
+  "hero": {
+    "title": "CONTROL YOUR",
+    "titleHighlight": "APPLE TV",
+    "badge": "NEW: Now Playing widget is here"
+  },
+
+  // Feature pages
+  "features": {
+    "cards": {
+      "deviceDiscovery": {
+        "title": "Device Discovery",
+        "description": "Automatically finds all Apple TVs..."
+      }
+    }
+  },
+
+  // FAQ
+  "faq": {
+    "items": {
+      "whatIsThis": {
+        "q": "What is Apple TV Remote?",
+        "a": "A native macOS app that lets you..."
+      }
+    }
+  }
+}
+```
+
+---
+
+## Component System
+
+### RetroUI Design System
+
+All components in `components/retroui/` follow neobrutalist design principles:
+
+- **Bold borders**: 2-3px black borders
+- **Hard shadows**: Offset box shadows (e.g., `shadow-[4px_4px_0_0_black]`)
+- **High contrast**: Strong color differentiation
+- **Brutalist typography**: Bold headlines, clear hierarchy
+
+Components are built on **Radix UI primitives** for accessibility:
+- Proper ARIA attributes
+- Keyboard navigation
+- Focus management
+- Screen reader support
+
+Example Button variants:
+```tsx
+<Button variant="default">Primary Action</Button>
+<Button variant="secondary">Secondary</Button>
+<Button variant="outline">Outlined</Button>
+<Button variant="ghost">Ghost</Button>
+```
+
+### Icon Registry
+
+Type-safe icon system using Lucide React:
+
+```tsx
+import { Icon, type IconId } from "@/lib/icons/registry";
+
+// Usage
+<Icon id="keyboard" size={24} />
+<Icon id="tv" size={32} className="text-primary" />
+```
+
+Available icons: `keyboard`, `tv`, `monitor`, `volume-2`, `play`, `pause`, `skip-forward`, `skip-back`, `home`, `menu`, `search`, `settings`, `chevron-up`, `chevron-down`, `chevron-left`, `chevron-right`, and 40+ more.
+
+### Lazy-Loaded Animations
+
+Framer Motion is lazy-loaded to reduce initial bundle:
+
+```tsx
+import { MotionDiv, AnimatePresence } from "@/lib/motion";
+
+// Instead of direct framer-motion import
+// import { motion } from "framer-motion";
+```
+
+This pattern reduces JavaScript payload for users who don't interact with animated elements.
+

+| auto-reconnect | /features/auto-reconnect | AutoReconnectAnimation |

+| dark-mode | /features/dark-mode | DarkModeAnimation |
+| neobrutalist-design | /features/neobrutalist-design | NeobrutalistDesignAnimation |

+# Apple TV Remote Marketing Website - Initial Repository Setup
+
+## Overview
+
+This repository contains the complete marketing website for **Apple TV Remote**, a native macOS desktop application that enables users to control their Apple TV directly from their Mac. The website is built with modern web technologies, featuring world-class internationalization (24 languages), accessibility compliance, and SEO optimization.
+
+**Live URL**: https://appletvremote.app
+
+---

+## Product: Apple TV Remote
+
+### What It Does
+
+Apple TV Remote is a macOS desktop application that transforms your Mac into a full-featured Apple TV remote control. Key capabilities:
+
+- **Device Discovery**: Automatically discovers all Apple TVs on your local network using Bonjour/mDNS protocol
+- **Full Remote Control**: 21 commands including navigation (up, down, left, right), select, menu, home, play/pause, volume controls, skip forward/back, Siri activation, sleep, and screen saver
+- **Keyboard Shortcuts**: Native keyboard support - arrow keys navigate, Enter selects, Space plays/pauses, Escape goes back, customizable shortcuts
+- **Now Playing Widget**: Real-time display of current media with album art, title, artist, and playback progress
+- **Text Input**: Type on Apple TV search keyboards using your Mac keyboard instead of navigating letter by letter
+- **System Tray Integration**: Quick access from your Mac menu bar with status indicators and quick actions
+- **Always on Top**: Keep the remote visible while using other apps
+- **Dark Mode**: Automatic theme switching based on macOS appearance settings
+- **Auto-Reconnect**: Automatic connection recovery when Mac wakes or network changes
+
+### Target Audience
+
+- Mac users who own Apple TVs
+- Power users who prefer keyboard over physical remotes
+- Developers working with Apple TV apps
+- Home theater enthusiasts
+
+---
+
+## Technology Stack
+
+### Core Framework
+- **Next.js 16** with App Router (React 19)
+- **TypeScript** for type safety
+- **pnpm** package manager
+
+### Styling
+- **Tailwind CSS v4** with CSS variables
+- **Neobrutalist design system** - bold, high-contrast UI with distinctive visual style
+- **Custom RetroUI component library** built on Radix primitives

+- **next-intl** for i18n (24 locales)
+- **RTL support** for Arabic, Persian, Hebrew
+- **JSONC source format** with build-time JSON conversion

+- **Framer Motion** with lazy loading for performance
+- **Feature page animations** demonstrating each capability

+### SEO
+- **JSON-LD structured data** (SoftwareApplication, FAQ, HowTo, Organization, BreadcrumbList)
+- **Dynamic sitemap** with all 24 locales
+- **Metadata generation** per page/locale

+# Apple TV Remote Marketing Website - Initial Repository Setup
+
+## Overview
+
+This repository contains the complete marketing website for **Apple TV Remote**, a native macOS desktop application that enables users to control their Apple TV directly from their Mac. The website is built with modern web technologies, featuring world-class internationalization (24 languages), accessibility compliance, and SEO optimization.
+
+**Live URL**: https://appletvremote.app
+
+---

+## Product: Apple TV Remote
+
+### What It Does
+
+Apple TV Remote is a macOS desktop application that transforms your Mac into a full-featured Apple TV remote control. Key capabilities:
+
+- **Device Discovery**: Automatically discovers all Apple TVs on your local network using Bonjour/mDNS protocol
+- **Full Remote Control**: 21 commands including navigation (up, down, left, right), select, menu, home, play/pause, volume controls, skip forward/back, Siri activation, sleep, and screen saver
+- **Keyboard Shortcuts**: Native keyboard support - arrow keys navigate, Enter selects, Space plays/pauses, Escape goes back, customizable shortcuts
+- **Now Playing Widget**: Real-time display of current media with album art, title, artist, and playback progress
+- **Text Input**: Type on Apple TV search keyboards using your Mac keyboard instead of navigating letter by letter
+- **System Tray Integration**: Quick access from your Mac menu bar with status indicators and quick actions
+- **Always on Top**: Keep the remote visible while using other apps
+- **Dark Mode**: Automatic theme switching based on macOS appearance settings
+- **Auto-Reconnect**: Automatic connection recovery when Mac wakes or network changes
+
+### Target Audience
+
+- Mac users who own Apple TVs
+- Power users who prefer keyboard over physical remotes
+- Developers working with Apple TV apps
+- Home theater enthusiasts
+
+---

+### Core Framework
+- **Next.js 16** with App Router (React 19)
+- **TypeScript** for type safety
+- **pnpm** package manager
+
+### Styling
+- **Tailwind CSS v4** with CSS variables
+- **Neobrutalist design system** - bold, high-contrast UI with distinctive visual style
+- **Custom RetroUI component library** built on Radix primitives
+
+### Internationalization
+- **next-intl** for i18n (24 locales)
+- **RTL support** for Arabic, Persian, Hebrew
+- **JSONC source format** with build-time JSON conversion

+This repository contains the complete marketing website for **Apple TV Remote**, a native macOS desktop application that enables users to control their Apple TV directly from their Mac. The website is built with modern web technologies, featuring world-class internationalization (24 languages), accessibility compliance, and SEO optimization.
+
+**Live URL**: https://appletvremote.app
+
+---
+
+## Product: Apple TV Remote
+
+### What It Does
+
+Apple TV Remote is a macOS desktop application that transforms your Mac into a full-featured Apple TV remote control. Key capabilities:
+
+- **Device Discovery**: Automatically discovers all Apple TVs on your local network using Bonjour/mDNS protocol
+- **Full Remote Control**: 21 commands including navigation (up, down, left, right), select, menu, home, play/pause, volume controls, skip forward/back, Siri activation, sleep, and screen saver
+- **Keyboard Shortcuts**: Native keyboard support - arrow keys navigate, Enter selects, Space plays/pauses, Escape goes back, customizable shortcuts
+- **Now Playing Widget**: Real-time display of current media with album art, title, artist, and playback progress
+- **Text Input**: Type on Apple TV search keyboards using your Mac keyboard instead of navigating letter by letter
+- **System Tray Integration**: Quick access from your Mac menu bar with status indicators and quick actions
+- **Always on Top**: Keep the remote visible while using other apps
+- **Dark Mode**: Automatic theme switching based on macOS appearance settings
+- **Auto-Reconnect**: Automatic connection recovery when Mac wakes or network changes
+
+### Target Audience
+
+- Mac users who own Apple TVs
+- Power users who prefer keyboard over physical remotes
+- Developers working with Apple TV apps
+- Home theater enthusiasts
+
+---
+
+## Technology Stack
+
+### Core Framework
+- **Next.js 16** with App Router (React 19)
+- **TypeScript** for type safety
+- **pnpm** package manager
+
+### Styling
+- **Tailwind CSS v4** with CSS variables
+- **Neobrutalist design system** - bold, high-contrast UI with distinctive visual style
+- **Custom RetroUI component library** built on Radix primitives
+
+### Internationalization
+- **next-intl** for i18n (24 locales)
+- **RTL support** for Arabic, Persian, Hebrew
+- **JSONC source format** with build-time JSON conversion
+
+### Animation
+- **Framer Motion** with lazy loading for performance
+- **Feature page animations** demonstrating each capability
+
+### SEO
+- **JSON-LD structured data** (SoftwareApplication, FAQ, HowTo, Organization, BreadcrumbList)
+- **Dynamic sitemap** with all 24 locales
+- **Metadata generation** per page/locale
+
+### Deployment
+- **Vercel** (primary) - SSR/SSG hybrid
+- **Cloudflare Pages** (alternative) - static export
+

+| nl | Dutch | LTR |
+| pl | Polish | LTR |
+| pt | Portuguese | LTR |
+| ru | Russian | LTR |
+| th | Thai | LTR |
+| tr | Turkish | LTR |
+| vi | Vietnamese | LTR |
+| zh | Chinese | LTR |
+
+### RTL Support
+
+RTL locales (Arabic, Persian, Hebrew) automatically receive:
+- `dir="rtl"` attribute on `<html>`
+- Tailwind RTL utilities work correctly
+- Component layouts flip appropriately
+
+Configuration in `i18n/config.ts`:
+```typescript
+export const rtlLocales = ['ar', 'fa', 'he'] as const;
+export const isRTL = (locale: Locale) =>
+  rtlLocales.includes(locale as typeof rtlLocales[number]);
+```
+
+### Translation Workflow
+
+1. **Source files** in `messages-src/{locale}/index.jsonc` (JSONC format with comments)
+2. **Build step** converts JSONC â†’ JSON via `scripts/jsonc-to-json.ts`
+3. **Output** to `messages/{locale}/index.json` (gitignored)
+
+Commands:
+```bash
+pnpm i18n:build   # Convert JSONC â†’ JSON
+pnpm i18n:audit   # Find missing translation keys
+pnpm i18n:lint    # Lint translation files
+pnpm i18n:compare # Compare across locales
+```
+
+### Translation Keys Structure
+
+```jsonc
+{
+  // Navigation
+  "nav": {
+    "features": "Features",
+    "pricing": "Pricing",
+    "download": "Download",
+    "faq": "FAQ"
+  },
+
+  // Hero section
+  "hero": {
+    "title": "CONTROL YOUR",
+    "titleHighlight": "APPLE TV",
+    "badge": "NEW: Now Playing widget is here"
+  },
+
+  // Feature pages
+  "features": {
+    "cards": {
+      "deviceDiscovery": {
+        "title": "Device Discovery",
+        "description": "Automatically finds all Apple TVs..."
+      }
+    }
+  },
+
+  // FAQ
+  "faq": {
+    "items": {
+      "whatIsThis": {
+        "q": "What is Apple TV Remote?",
+        "a": "A native macOS app that lets you..."
+      }
+    }
+  }
+}
+```
+
+---
+
+## Component System
+
+### RetroUI Design System
+
+All components in `components/retroui/` follow neobrutalist design principles:
+
+- **Bold borders**: 2-3px black borders
+- **Hard shadows**: Offset box shadows (e.g., `shadow-[4px_4px_0_0_black]`)
+- **High contrast**: Strong color differentiation
+- **Brutalist typography**: Bold headlines, clear hierarchy
+
+Components are built on **Radix UI primitives** for accessibility:
+- Proper ARIA attributes
+- Keyboard navigation
+- Focus management
+- Screen reader support
+
+Example Button variants:
+```tsx
+<Button variant="default">Primary Action</Button>
+<Button variant="secondary">Secondary</Button>
+<Button variant="outline">Outlined</Button>
+<Button variant="ghost">Ghost</Button>
+```
+
+### Icon Registry
+
+Type-safe icon system using Lucide React:
+
+```tsx
+import { Icon, type IconId } from "@/lib/icons/registry";
+
+// Usage
+<Icon id="keyboard" size={24} />
+<Icon id="tv" size={32} className="text-primary" />
+```
+
+Available icons: `keyboard`, `tv`, `monitor`, `volume-2`, `play`, `pause`, `skip-forward`, `skip-back`, `home`, `menu`, `search`, `settings`, `chevron-up`, `chevron-down`, `chevron-left`, `chevron-right`, and 40+ more.

+# Apple TV Remote Marketing Website - Initial Repository Setup
+
+## Overview
+
+This repository contains the complete marketing website for **Apple TV Remote**, a native macOS desktop application that enables users to control their Apple TV directly from their Mac. +
+**Live URL**: https://appletvremote.app

+## Product: Apple TV Remote
+
+### What It Does
+
+Apple TV Remote is a macOS desktop application that transforms your Mac into a full-featured Apple TV remote control. Key capabilities:
+
+- **Device Discovery**: Automatically discovers all Apple TVs on your local network using Bonjour/mDNS protocol
+- **Full Remote Control**: 21 commands including navigation (up, down, left, right), select, menu, home, play/pause, volume controls, skip forward/back, Siri activation, sleep, and screen saver
+- **Keyboard Shortcuts**: Native keyboard support - arrow keys navigate, Enter selects, Space plays/pauses, Escape goes back, customizable shortcuts
+- **Now Playing Widget**: Real-time display of current media with album art, title, artist, and playback progress
+- **Text Input**: Type on Apple TV search keyboards using your Mac keyboard instead of navigating letter by letter
+- **System Tray Integration**: Quick access from your Mac menu bar with status indicators and quick actions
+- **Always on Top**: Keep the remote visible while using other apps
+- **Dark Mode**: Automatic theme switching based on macOS appearance settings
+- **Auto-Reconnect**: Automatic connection recovery when Mac wakes or network changes
+
+### Target Audience
+
+- Mac users who own Apple TVs
+- Power users who prefer keyboard over physical remotes
+- Developers working with Apple TV apps
+- Home theater enthusiasts
+

+- **next-intl** for i18n (24 locales)

+### SEO

+    â”œâ”€â”€ opengraph-image.png       # Default OG image
+    â””â”€â”€ twitter-image.png         # Twitter card image
+```

+### Route Groups Explained
+
+Next.js 16 route groups organize pages without affecting URL structure:
+
+| Route Group | Pages | Purpose |
+|-------------|-------|---------|
+| `(marketing)` | `/`, `/about`, `/download`, `/pricing`, `/features/*` | Core marketing content |
+| `(legal)` | `/privacy`, `/terms`, `/refund-policy` | Legal documents |
+| `(support)` | `/faq`, `/contact` | User support |
+
+Each group can have its own layout, loading states, and error boundaries.
+
+### Dynamic Routes
+
+**Feature pages** use `[feature]` dynamic segment:
+- URL: `/en/features/device-discovery`
+- File: `app/[locale]/(marketing)/features/[feature]/page.tsx`
+- Content: `lib/content/features/device-discovery.ts`
+
+**Locale routing** uses `[locale]` segment at root:
+- All 24 locales supported
+- Automatic locale detection
+- SEO-friendly URLs with `localePrefix: 'always'`
+

+## Internationalization System
+
+### Supported Locales (24)
+
+| Code | Language | Direction |
+|------|----------|-----------|
+| en | English | LTR |
+| ar | Arabic | **RTL** |
+| bg | Bulgarian | LTR |
+| cs | Czech | LTR |
+| de | German | LTR |
+| es | Spanish | LTR |
+| fa | Persian | **RTL** |
+| fil | Filipino | LTR |
+| fr | French | LTR |
+| he | Hebrew | **RTL** |
+| hi | Hindi | LTR |
+| hu | Hungarian | LTR |
+| id | Indonesian | LTR |
+| it | Italian | LTR |
+| ja | Japanese | LTR |
+| nl | Dutch | LTR |

+| pt | Portuguese | LTR |
+| ru | Russian | LTR |
+| th | Thai | LTR |
+| tr | Turkish | LTR |
+| vi | Vietnamese | LTR |
+| zh | Chinese | LTR |
+
+### RTL Support
+
+RTL locales (Arabic, Persian, Hebrew) automatically receive:

+- Tailwind RTL utilities work correctly
+- Component layouts flip appropriately

+export const isRTL = (locale: Locale) =>

+```

+

+3. **Output** to `messages/{locale}/index.json` (gitignored)

+```

+

+  // Navigation
+  "nav": {
+    "features": "Features",
+    "pricing": "Pricing",
+    "download": "Download",
+    "faq": "FAQ"
+  },
+
+  // Hero section
+  "hero": {
+    "title": "CONTROL YOUR",
+    "titleHighlight": "APPLE TV",
+    "badge": "NEW: Now Playing widget is here"
+  },
+
+  // Feature pages
+  "features": {
+    "cards": {
+      "deviceDiscovery": {
+        "title": "Device Discovery",
+        "description": "Automatically finds all Apple TVs..."
+      }
+    }
+  },
+
+  // FAQ
+  "faq": {
+    "items": {
+      "whatIsThis": {
+        "q": "What is Apple TV Remote?",
+        "a": "A native macOS app that lets you..."
+      }
+    }
+  }
+}
+```
+

+## Component System
+
+### RetroUI Design System
+
+All components in `components/retroui/` follow neobrutalist design principles:
+
+- **Bold borders**: 2-3px black borders
+- **Hard shadows**: Offset box shadows (e.g., `shadow-[4px_4px_0_0_black]`)
+- **High contrast**: Strong color differentiation
+- **Brutalist typography**: Bold headlines, clear hierarchy
+
+Components are built on **Radix UI primitives** for accessibility:
+- Proper ARIA attributes
+- Keyboard navigation
+- Focus management
+- Screen reader support
+
+Example Button variants:
+```tsx
+<Button variant="default">Primary Action</Button>
+<Button variant="secondary">Secondary</Button>
+<Button variant="outline">Outlined</Button>
+<Button variant="ghost">Ghost</Button>
+```
+
+### Icon Registry
+
+Type-safe icon system using Lucide React:
+
+```tsx
+import { Icon, type IconId } from "@/lib/icons/registry";
+
+// Usage

+<Icon id="tv" size={32} className="text-primary" />
+```
+

+

+
+Framer Motion is lazy-loaded to reduce initial bundle:
+
+```tsx
+import { MotionDiv, AnimatePresence } from "@/lib/motion";

+// import { motion } from "framer-motion";
+```
+
+This pattern reduces JavaScript payload for users who don't interact with animated elements.
+

+| system-tray | /features/system-tray | SystemTrayAnimation |

+| dark-mode | /features/dark-mode | DarkModeAnimation |
+| neobrutalist-design | /features/neobrutalist-design | NeobrutalistDesignAnimation |

+
+Feature content is defined in `lib/content/features/{id}.ts`:

Additionally, the messages-src directory contains 24 locale folders including 'ko' (Korean), but Korean is missing from the i18n/config.ts locales array and is not documented in the Supported Locales table. This is a discrepancy between the codebase state and the documentation that needs to be resolved - either add Korean to the configuration or remove it from messages-src and update the documentation to reflect 23 locales.

+## Overview
+
+This repository contains the complete marketing website for **Apple TV Remote**, a native macOS desktop application that enables users to control their Apple TV directly from their Mac. +- **Full Remote Control**: 21 commands including navigation (up, down, left, right), select, menu, home, play/pause, volume controls, skip forward/back, Siri activation, sleep, and screen saver
+- **Keyboard Shortcuts**: Native keyboard support - arrow keys navigate, Enter selects, Space plays/pauses, Escape goes back, customizable shortcuts
+- **Now Playing Widget**: Real-time display of current media with album art, title, artist, and playback progress
+- **Text Input**: Type on Apple TV search keyboards using your Mac keyboard instead of navigating letter by letter
+- **System Tray Integration**: Quick access from your Mac menu bar with status indicators and quick actions
+- **Always on Top**: Keep the remote visible while using other apps
+- **Dark Mode**: Automatic theme switching based on macOS appearance settings
+- **Auto-Reconnect**: Automatic connection recovery when Mac wakes or network changes
+
+### Target Audience
+
+- Mac users who own Apple TVs
+- Power users who prefer keyboard over physical remotes
+- Developers working with Apple TV apps
+- Home theater enthusiasts

+# Apple TV Remote Marketing Website - Initial Repository Setup
+
+## Overview
+
+This repository contains the complete marketing website for **Apple TV Remote**, a native macOS desktop application that enables users to control their Apple TV directly from their Mac. The website is built with modern web technologies, featuring world-class internationalization (24 languages), accessibility compliance, and SEO optimization.
+
+**Live URL**: https://appletvremote.app
+
+---
+
+## Product: Apple TV Remote
+
+### What It Does
+
+Apple TV Remote is a macOS desktop application that transforms your Mac into a full-featured Apple TV remote control. Key capabilities:
+
+- **Device Discovery**: Automatically discovers all Apple TVs on your local network using Bonjour/mDNS protocol
+- **Full Remote Control**: 21 commands including navigation (up, down, left, right), select, menu, home, play/pause, volume controls, skip forward/back, Siri activation, sleep, and screen saver
+- **Keyboard Shortcuts**: Native keyboard support - arrow keys navigate, Enter selects, Space plays/pauses, Escape goes back, customizable shortcuts
+- **Now Playing Widget**: Real-time display of current media with album art, title, artist, and playback progress
+- **Text Input**: Type on Apple TV search keyboards using your Mac keyboard instead of navigating letter by letter
+- **System Tray Integration**: Quick access from your Mac menu bar with status indicators and quick actions
+- **Always on Top**: Keep the remote visible while using other apps
+- **Dark Mode**: Automatic theme switching based on macOS appearance settings
+- **Auto-Reconnect**: Automatic connection recovery when Mac wakes or network changes
+
+### Target Audience
+
+- Mac users who own Apple TVs
+- Power users who prefer keyboard over physical remotes
+- Developers working with Apple TV apps
+- Home theater enthusiasts
+
+---
+
+## Technology Stack
+
+### Core Framework
+- **Next.js 16** with App Router (React 19)
+- **TypeScript** for type safety
+- **pnpm** package manager
+
+### Styling
+- **Tailwind CSS v4** with CSS variables
+- **Neobrutalist design system** - bold, high-contrast UI with distinctive visual style
+- **Custom RetroUI component library** built on Radix primitives
+
+### Internationalization
+- **next-intl** for i18n (24 locales)
+- **RTL support** for Arabic, Persian, Hebrew
+- **JSONC source format** with build-time JSON conversion
+
+### Animation
+- **Framer Motion** with lazy loading for performance
+- **Feature page animations** demonstrating each capability
+
+### SEO
+- **JSON-LD structured data** (SoftwareApplication, FAQ, HowTo, Organization, BreadcrumbList)
+- **Dynamic sitemap** with all 24 locales
+- **Metadata generation** per page/locale
+
+### Deployment
+- **Vercel** (primary) - SSR/SSG hybrid
+- **Cloudflare Pages** (alternative) - static export
+

+# Apple TV Remote Marketing Website - Initial Repository Setup
+
+## Overview
+
+This repository contains the complete marketing website for **Apple TV Remote**, a native macOS desktop application that enables users to control their Apple TV directly from their Mac. The website is built with modern web technologies, featuring world-class internationalization (24 languages), accessibility compliance, and SEO optimization.
+
+**Live URL**: https://appletvremote.app
+
+---
+
+## Product: Apple TV Remote
+
+### What It Does
+
+Apple TV Remote is a macOS desktop application that transforms your Mac into a full-featured Apple TV remote control. Key capabilities:
+
+- **Device Discovery**: Automatically discovers all Apple TVs on your local network using Bonjour/mDNS protocol
+- **Full Remote Control**: 21 commands including navigation (up, down, left, right), select, menu, home, play/pause, volume controls, skip forward/back, Siri activation, sleep, and screen saver
+- **Keyboard Shortcuts**: Native keyboard support - arrow keys navigate, Enter selects, Space plays/pauses, Escape goes back, customizable shortcuts
+- **Now Playing Widget**: Real-time display of current media with album art, title, artist, and playback progress
+- **Text Input**: Type on Apple TV search keyboards using your Mac keyboard instead of navigating letter by letter
+- **System Tray Integration**: Quick access from your Mac menu bar with status indicators and quick actions
+- **Always on Top**: Keep the remote visible while using other apps
+- **Dark Mode**: Automatic theme switching based on macOS appearance settings
+- **Auto-Reconnect**: Automatic connection recovery when Mac wakes or network changes
+
+### Target Audience
+
+- Mac users who own Apple TVs
+- Power users who prefer keyboard over physical remotes
+- Developers working with Apple TV apps
+- Home theater enthusiasts
+
+---
+
+## Technology Stack
+
+### Core Framework
+- **Next.js 16** with App Router (React 19)
+- **TypeScript** for type safety
+- **pnpm** package manager
+
+### Styling
+- **Tailwind CSS v4** with CSS variables
+- **Neobrutalist design system** - bold, high-contrast UI with distinctive visual style
+- **Custom RetroUI component library** built on Radix primitives
+
+### Internationalization
+- **next-intl** for i18n (24 locales)
+- **RTL support** for Arabic, Persian, Hebrew
+- **JSONC source format** with build-time JSON conversion
+
+### Animation
+- **Framer Motion** with lazy loading for performance
+- **Feature page animations** demonstrating each capability
+
+### SEO
+- **JSON-LD structured data** (SoftwareApplication, FAQ, HowTo, Organization, BreadcrumbList)
+- **Dynamic sitemap** with all 24 locales
+- **Metadata generation** per page/locale
+
+### Deployment
+- **Vercel** (primary) - SSR/SSG hybrid
+- **Cloudflare Pages** (alternative) - static export
+

+## Overview

+This repository contains the complete marketing website for **Apple TV Remote**, a native macOS desktop application that enables users to control their Apple TV directly from their Mac. +## Product: Apple TV Remote

+### What It Does

+Apple TV Remote is a macOS desktop application that transforms your Mac into a full-featured Apple TV remote control. Key capabilities:

+- **Dark Mode**: Automatic theme switching based on macOS appearance settings
+- **Auto-Reconnect**: Automatic connection recovery when Mac wakes or network changes

+All components in `components/retroui/` follow neobrutalist design principles:
+
+- **Bold borders**: 2-3px black borders
+- **Hard shadows**: Offset box shadows (e.g., `shadow-[4px_4px_0_0_black]`)
+- **High contrast**: Strong color differentiation
+- **Brutalist typography**: Bold headlines, clear hierarchy
+
+Components are built on **Radix UI primitives** for accessibility:
+- Proper ARIA attributes
+- Keyboard navigation
+- Focus management
+- Screen reader support
+

+```tsx

+<Button variant="secondary">Secondary</Button>
+<Button variant="outline">Outlined</Button>
+<Button variant="ghost">Ghost</Button>

+# Apple TV Remote Marketing Website - Initial Repository Setup

+## Overview
+
+This repository contains the complete marketing website for **Apple TV Remote**, a native macOS desktop application that enables users to control their Apple TV directly from their Mac. The website is built with modern web technologies, featuring world-class internationalization (24 languages), accessibility compliance, and SEO optimization.

+## Product: Apple TV Remote
+
+### What It Does
+
+Apple TV Remote is a macOS desktop application that transforms your Mac into a full-featured Apple TV remote control. Key capabilities:
+
+- **Device Discovery**: Automatically discovers all Apple TVs on your local network using Bonjour/mDNS protocol
+- **Full Remote Control**: 21 commands including navigation (up, down, left, right), select, menu, home, play/pause, volume controls, skip forward/back, Siri activation, sleep, and screen saver
+- **Keyboard Shortcuts**: Native keyboard support - arrow keys navigate, Enter selects, Space plays/pauses, Escape goes back, customizable shortcuts
+- **Now Playing Widget**: Real-time display of current media with album art, title, artist, and playback progress
+- **Text Input**: Type on Apple TV search keyboards using your Mac keyboard instead of navigating letter by letter
+- **System Tray Integration**: Quick access from your Mac menu bar with status indicators and quick actions
+- **Always on Top**: Keep the remote visible while using other apps
+- **Dark Mode**: Automatic theme switching based on macOS appearance settings
+- **Auto-Reconnect**: Automatic connection recovery when Mac wakes or network changes
+
+### Target Audience
+
+- Mac users who own Apple TVs
+- Power users who prefer keyboard over physical remotes
+- Developers working with Apple TV apps
+- Home theater enthusiasts
+

+### Route Groups Explained
+
+Next.js 16 route groups organize pages without affecting URL structure:
+
+| Route Group | Pages | Purpose |
+|-------------|-------|---------|
+| `(marketing)` | `/`, `/about`, `/download`, `/pricing`, `/features/*` | Core marketing content |
+| `(legal)` | `/privacy`, `/terms`, `/refund-policy` | Legal documents |
+| `(support)` | `/faq`, `/contact` | User support |
+
+Each group can have its own layout, loading states, and error boundaries.
+
+### Dynamic Routes
+
+**Feature pages** use `[feature]` dynamic segment:
+- URL: `/en/features/device-discovery`
+- File: `app/[locale]/(marketing)/features/[feature]/page.tsx`
+- Content: `lib/content/features/device-discovery.ts`
+
+**Locale routing** uses `[locale]` segment at root:
+- All 24 locales supported
+- Automatic locale detection
+- SEO-friendly URLs with `localePrefix: 'always'`
+

+## Internationalization System

+### Supported Locales (24)
+
+| Code | Language | Direction |
+|------|----------|-----------|
+| en | English | LTR |
+| ar | Arabic | **RTL** |
+| bg | Bulgarian | LTR |
+| cs | Czech | LTR |
+| de | German | LTR |
+| es | Spanish | LTR |
+| fa | Persian | **RTL** |
+| fil | Filipino | LTR |
+| fr | French | LTR |
+| he | Hebrew | **RTL** |
+| hi | Hindi | LTR |
+| hu | Hungarian | LTR |
+| id | Indonesian | LTR |
+| it | Italian | LTR |
+| ja | Japanese | LTR |
+| nl | Dutch | LTR |
+| pl | Polish | LTR |
+| pt | Portuguese | LTR |
+| ru | Russian | LTR |
+| th | Thai | LTR |
+| tr | Turkish | LTR |
+| vi | Vietnamese | LTR |
+| zh | Chinese | LTR |
+
+### RTL Support
+
+RTL locales (Arabic, Persian, Hebrew) automatically receive:
+- `dir="rtl"` attribute on `<html>`
+- Tailwind RTL utilities work correctly
+- Component layouts flip appropriately
+
+Configuration in `i18n/config.ts`:
+```typescript
+export const rtlLocales = ['ar', 'fa', 'he'] as const;
+export const isRTL = (locale: Locale) =>
+  rtlLocales.includes(locale as typeof rtlLocales[number]);
+```
+
+### Translation Workflow
+
+1. **Source files** in `messages-src/{locale}/index.jsonc` (JSONC format with comments)
+2. **Build step** converts JSONC â†’ JSON via `scripts/jsonc-to-json.ts`
+3. **Output** to `messages/{locale}/index.json` (gitignored)
+
+Commands:
+```bash
+pnpm i18n:build   # Convert JSONC â†’ JSON
+pnpm i18n:audit   # Find missing translation keys
+pnpm i18n:lint    # Lint translation files
+pnpm i18n:compare # Compare across locales
+```
+
+### Translation Keys Structure
+
+```jsonc
+{
+  // Navigation
+  "nav": {
+    "features": "Features",
+    "pricing": "Pricing",
+    "download": "Download",
+    "faq": "FAQ"
+  },
+
+  // Hero section
+  "hero": {
+    "title": "CONTROL YOUR",
+    "titleHighlight": "APPLE TV",
+    "badge": "NEW: Now Playing widget is here"
+  },
+
+  // Feature pages
+  "features": {
+    "cards": {
+      "deviceDiscovery": {
+        "title": "Device Discovery",
+        "description": "Automatically finds all Apple TVs..."
+      }
+    }
+  },
+
+  // FAQ
+  "faq": {
+    "items": {
+      "whatIsThis": {
+        "q": "What is Apple TV Remote?",
+        "a": "A native macOS app that lets you..."
+      }
+    }
+  }
+}
+```
+
+---
+
+## Component System
+
+### RetroUI Design System
+
+All components in `components/retroui/` follow neobrutalist design principles:
+
+- **Bold borders**: 2-3px black borders
+- **Hard shadows**: Offset box shadows (e.g., `shadow-[4px_4px_0_0_black]`)
+- **High contrast**: Strong color differentiation
+- **Brutalist typography**: Bold headlines, clear hierarchy
+
+Components are built on **Radix UI primitives** for accessibility:
+- Proper ARIA attributes
+- Keyboard navigation
+- Focus management
+- Screen reader support
+
+Example Button variants:
+```tsx
+<Button variant="default">Primary Action</Button>
+<Button variant="secondary">Secondary</Button>
+<Button variant="outline">Outlined</Button>
+<Button variant="ghost">Ghost</Button>
+```
+
+### Icon Registry
+
+Type-safe icon system using Lucide React:
+
+```tsx
+import { Icon, type IconId } from "@/lib/icons/registry";
+
+// Usage
+<Icon id="keyboard" size={24} />
+<Icon id="tv" size={32} className="text-primary" />
+```
+
+Available icons: `keyboard`, `tv`, `monitor`, `volume-2`, `play`, `pause`, `skip-forward`, `skip-back`, `home`, `menu`, `search`, `settings`, `chevron-up`, `chevron-down`, `chevron-left`, `chevron-right`, and 40+ more.
+
+### Lazy-Loaded Animations
+
+Framer Motion is lazy-loaded to reduce initial bundle:
+
+```tsx
+import { MotionDiv, AnimatePresence } from "@/lib/motion";
+
+// Instead of direct framer-motion import
+// import { motion } from "framer-motion";
+```
+
+This pattern reduces JavaScript payload for users who don't interact with animated elements.
+
+---
+

+
+### 11 Feature Pages
+
+Each feature has a dedicated page with:
+- Hero section with feature title/description
+- Animated demonstration
+- Benefits list
+- How-it-works steps
+- Call-to-action

+| remote-control | /features/remote-control | RemoteControlAnimation |
+| keyboard-shortcuts | /features/keyboard-shortcuts | KeyboardShortcutsAnimation |
+| now-playing | /features/now-playing | NowPlayingAnimation |
+| volume-control | /features/volume-control | VolumeControlAnimation |
+| text-input | /features/text-input | TextInputAnimation |
+| auto-reconnect | /features/auto-reconnect | AutoReconnectAnimation |
+| system-tray | /features/system-tray | SystemTrayAnimation |
+| always-on-top | /features/always-on-top | AlwaysOnTopAnimation |
+| dark-mode | /features/dark-mode | DarkModeAnimation |
+| neobrutalist-design | /features/neobrutalist-design | NeobrutalistDesignAnimation |

+This repository contains the complete marketing website for **Apple TV Remote**, a native macOS desktop application that enables users to control their Apple TV directly from their Mac. +- **System Tray Integration**: Quick access from your Mac menu bar with status indicators and quick actions
+- **Always on Top**: Keep the remote visible while using other apps
+- **Dark Mode**: Automatic theme switching based on macOS appearance settings
+- **Auto-Reconnect**: Automatic connection recovery when Mac wakes or network changes

+- Developers working with Apple TV apps
+- Home theater enthusiasts

+### Route Groups Explained
+
+Next.js 16 route groups organize pages without affecting URL structure:
+
+| Route Group | Pages | Purpose |
+|-------------|-------|---------|
+| `(marketing)` | `/`, `/about`, `/download`, `/pricing`, `/features/*` | Core marketing content |
+| `(legal)` | `/privacy`, `/terms`, `/refund-policy` | Legal documents |
+| `(support)` | `/faq`, `/contact` | User support |
+
+Each group can have its own layout, loading states, and error boundaries.
+
+### Dynamic Routes
+
+**Feature pages** use `[feature]` dynamic segment:
+- URL: `/en/features/device-discovery`
+- File: `app/[locale]/(marketing)/features/[feature]/page.tsx`
+- Content: `lib/content/features/device-discovery.ts`
+
+**Locale routing** uses `[locale]` segment at root:
+- All 24 locales supported
+- Automatic locale detection
+- SEO-friendly URLs with `localePrefix: 'always'`

+### RTL Support
+
+RTL locales (Arabic, Persian, Hebrew) automatically receive:
+- `dir="rtl"` attribute on `<html>`
+- Tailwind RTL utilities work correctly
+- Component layouts flip appropriately
+
+Configuration in `i18n/config.ts`:
+```typescript
+export const rtlLocales = ['ar', 'fa', 'he'] as const;
+export const isRTL = (locale: Locale) =>
+  rtlLocales.includes(locale as typeof rtlLocales[number]);
+```
+
+### Translation Workflow
+
+1. **Source files** in `messages-src/{locale}/index.jsonc` (JSONC format with comments)
+2. **Build step** converts JSONC â†’ JSON via `scripts/jsonc-to-json.ts`
+3. **Output** to `messages/{locale}/index.json` (gitignored)
+
+Commands:
+```bash
+pnpm i18n:build   # Convert JSONC â†’ JSON
+pnpm i18n:audit   # Find missing translation keys
+pnpm i18n:lint    # Lint translation files
+pnpm i18n:compare # Compare across locales

+## Component System
+
+### RetroUI Design System
+
+All components in `components/retroui/` follow neobrutalist design principles:
+
+- **Bold borders**: 2-3px black borders
+- **Hard shadows**: Offset box shadows (e.g., `shadow-[4px_4px_0_0_black]`)
+- **High contrast**: Strong color differentiation
+- **Brutalist typography**: Bold headlines, clear hierarchy
+
+Components are built on **Radix UI primitives** for accessibility:
+- Proper ARIA attributes
+- Keyboard navigation
+- Focus management
+- Screen reader support
+
+Example Button variants:
+```tsx
+<Button variant="default">Primary Action</Button>
+<Button variant="secondary">Secondary</Button>
+<Button variant="outline">Outlined</Button>
+<Button variant="ghost">Ghost</Button>
+```
+
+### Icon Registry
+
+Type-safe icon system using Lucide React:
+
+```tsx
+import { Icon, type IconId } from "@/lib/icons/registry";
+
+// Usage
+<Icon id="keyboard" size={24} />
+<Icon id="tv" size={32} className="text-primary" />
+```
+
+Available icons: `keyboard`, `tv`, `monitor`, `volume-2`, `play`, `pause`, `skip-forward`, `skip-back`, `home`, `menu`, `search`, `settings`, `chevron-up`, `chevron-down`, `chevron-left`, `chevron-right`, and 40+ more.
